args.name: locales
args.description:
Allows to optionally override locale filtering behaviour in the query's subtree.

Note that `createdBy` is a model without localized fields and will not be affected directly by this argument, however the locales will be passed on to any relational fields in the query's subtree for filtering.
For related models with localized fields in the query's subtree, the first locale matching the provided list of locales will be returned, entries with non matching locales will be filtered out.

This argument will overwrite any existing locale filtering defined in the query's tree for the subtree.

Allows to optionally override locale filtering behaviour in the query's subtree.

Note that `scheduledIn` is a model without localized fields and will not be affected directly by this argument, however the locales will be passed on to any relational fields in the query's subtree for filtering.
For related models with localized fields in the query's subtree, the first locale matching the provided list of locales will be returned, entries with non matching locales will be filtered out.

This argument will overwrite any existing locale filtering defined in the query's tree for the subtree.

inputFields.name: format
inputFields.description:
Transforms a document into a desired file type.
See this matrix for format support:

PDF:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, png, svg, txt, and webp
DOC:	docx, html, jpg, odt, pdf, png, svg, txt, and webp
DOCX:	doc, html, jpg, odt, pdf, png, svg, txt, and webp
ODT:	doc, docx, html, jpg, pdf, png, svg, txt, and webp
XLS:	jpg, pdf, ods, png, svg, xlsx, and webp
XLSX:	jpg, pdf, ods, png, svg, xls, and webp
ODS:	jpg, pdf, png, xls, svg, xlsx, and webp
PPT:	jpg, odp, pdf, png, svg, pptx, and webp
PPTX:	jpg, odp, pdf, png, svg, ppt, and webp
ODP:	jpg, pdf, png, ppt, svg, pptx, and webp
BMP:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
GIF:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
JPG:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
PNG:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
WEBP:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
TIFF:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
AI:	    jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
PSD:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, svg, and webp
SVG:	jpg, odp, ods, odt, pdf, png, and webp
HTML:	jpg, odt, pdf, svg, txt, and webp
TXT:	jpg, html, odt, pdf, svg, and webp

inputFields.name: output
inputFields.description: Changes the output for the file.

types.name: Float
types.description: The `Float` scalar type represents signed double-precision fractional values as specified by [IEEE 754](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IEEE_floating_point).

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as "4") or integer (such as 4) input value will be accepted as an ID.

enumValues.name: clip
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit within the specified parameters without distorting, cropping, or changing the aspect ratio.

enumValues.name: crop
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit the specified parameters exactly by removing any parts of the image that don't fit within the boundaries.

enumValues.name: scale
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit the specified parameters exactly by scaling the image to the desired size. The aspect ratio of the image is not respected and the image can be distorted using this method.

enumValues.name: max
enumValues.description: Resizes the image to fit within the parameters, but as opposed to 'fit:clip' will not scale the image if the image is smaller than the output size.

inputFields.name: width
inputFields.description: The width in pixels to resize the image to. The value must be an integer from 1 to 10000.

inputFields.name: height
inputFields.description: The height in pixels to resize the image to. The value must be an integer from 1 to 10000.

inputFields.name: fit
inputFields.description: The default value for the fit parameter is fit:clip.

inputFields.name: resize
inputFields.description: Resizes the image

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

args.name: locales
args.description:
Allows to optionally override locale filtering behaviour in the query's subtree.

Note that `createdBy` is a model without localized fields and will not be affected directly by this argument, however the locales will be passed on to any relational fields in the query's subtree for filtering.
For related models with localized fields in the query's subtree, the first locale matching the provided list of locales will be returned, entries with non matching locales will be filtered out.

This argument will overwrite any existing locale filtering defined in the query's tree for the subtree.

Note that `createdBy` is a model without localized fields and will not be affected directly by this argument, however the locales will be passed on to any relational fields in the query's subtree for filtering.
For related models with localized fields in the query's subtree, the first locale matching the provided list of locales will be returned, entries with non matching locales will be filtered out.

This argument will overwrite any existing locale filtering defined in the query's tree for the subtree.

args.name: locales
args.description:
Allows to optionally override locale filtering behaviour in the query's subtree.

Note that `createdBy` is a model without localized fields and will not be affected directly by this argument, however the locales will be passed on to any relational fields in the query's subtree for filtering.
For related models with localized fields in the query's subtree, the first locale matching the provided list of locales will be returned, entries with non matching locales will be filtered out.

This argument will overwrite any existing locale filtering defined in the query's tree for the subtree.

args.name: locales
args.description:
Allows to optionally override locale filtering behaviour in the query's subtree.

Note that `createdBy` is a model without localized fields and will not be affected directly by this argument, however the locales will be passed on to any relational fields in the query's subtree for filtering.
For related models with localized fields in the query's subtree, the first locale matching the provided list of locales will be returned, entries with non matching locales will be filtered out.

This argument will overwrite any existing locale filtering defined in the query's tree for the subtree.

fields.description: User that last updated this document

For related models with localized fields in the query's subtree, the first locale matching the provided list of locales will be returned, entries with non matching locales will be filtered out.

This argument will overwrite any existing locale filtering defined in the query's tree for the subtree.

args.description: Adds field validations

args.description: The model's storage ID

args.description: Marks list richText field return type

args.description: The name of the associated RichText type

args.name: isUnidirectional
args.description: Marks relation fields that do not have a reverse side counterpart

args.name: replaceableWithUserId
args.description: Specifies if the filter's value can be replaced by the current user's id

args.name: isRequired
args.description: marks if field is required (non-null)

args.name: isComponent
args.description: marks if type is a component

args.description: marks if a input type allows to set position in addition to data

args.name: unionFieldDetailsForVirtualMemberSide
args.description: main side details of union field on component

args.name: resources
args.description: Policy resource names.

args.name: actions
args.description: Policy action names.

args.name: table
args.description: postgres table name

args.name: localizationTable
args.description: postgres localization table name

args.name: column
args.description: postgres column name

args.name: id
args.description: hardcoded postgres id value for enums

args.name: join
args.description: postgres join on name

args.name: idColumn
args.description: Specifies column for system id field

args.name: prio
args.description: Specifies column for native sorting for relational fields

args.name: memberColumns
args.description: Specifies columns for union member fields

args.name: updatedAtColumn
args.description: Specifies system updatedAt column

args.name: componentParentFieldValue
args.description: Specifies the value used to fill the parent_field column that's used to identify the parent field a component got created for

args.name: versionTable
args.description: postgres table name for the versions

args.name: url
args.description: url to fetch the remote content from

args.name: method
args.description: HTTP method used to fetch the remote content from

args.name: sourceType
args.description: Which type of api should be called. Currently supported: GRAPHQL, REST

args.name: headers
args.description: optional headers that will be sent in the remote call

args.name: docPlaceholderFields
args.description: list of field storage ids that will be fetched in any case from the content db to make them available for {{doc.*}} template placeholders in headers, parameters etc for the remote call

args.name: ttlInSeconds
args.description: optional ttl value used for caching

args.name: forwardClientHeaders
args.description: Flag whether to pass headers that are sent by the client to the remote source or not

args.name: gqlQuery
args.description: GraphQL entry point query that will be used to fetch the remote type in case of a remote GraphQL PI

args.name: gqlOperationName
args.description: Operation name of the gqlQuery in case of a remote GraphQL API

args.name: gqlEntryPointPath
args.description: JSON path pointing to the entry point type that is defined by the GraphQL Query.

args.name: debugEnabled
args.description: Flag whether debug options are enabled on a given field or not

directives.name: skip
directives.description: The @skip directive may be provided for fields, fragment spreads, and inline fragments, and allows for conditional exclusion during execution as described by the if argument.
